abstract: This paper studies multiagent distributed estimation under sensor attacks. Individual agents make sensor measurements of an unknown parameter belonging to a compact set, and, at every time step, a fraction of the agents’ sensor measurements may fall under attack and take arbitrary values. We present the saturated innovation update (<inline-formula><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\mathcal{SIU}$</tex-math></inline-formula>) algorithm for distributed estimation resilient to sensor attacks. Under the iterative <inline-formula><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\mathcal{SIU}$</tex-math></inline-formula> algorithm, if less than one half of the agent sensors fall under attack, then, all of the agents’ estimates converge at a polynomial rate (with respect to the number of iterations) to the true parameter. The resilience of <inline-formula><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\mathcal{SIU}$</tex-math></inline-formula> to sensor attacks does not depend on the topology of the interagent communication network, as long as it remains connected. We demonstrate the performance of <inline-formula><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\mathcal{SIU}$</tex-math></inline-formula> with numerical examples.
